paragraphs: WanderRest (ex-Wander365) helps travelers browse curated trips, treks, and getaways while the team manages packages, itineraries, and leads through a lightweight CRM. The public site surfaces destinations, day-wise details, FAQs, and galleries in a conversion-focused layout.

On the backend, the admin CRM centralizes enquiries, pricing matrices, itinerary templates, and follow-ups so the team no longer juggles WhatsApp and spreadsheets. Lead source tracking, UTM capture, and WhatsApp-ready shares keep the pipeline moving.

The architecture is intentionally simple for daily use yet ready for white-labeling: brand layers stay separate from core models, and the stack can be deployed on Vercel/Netlify/Firebase with a Dockerized API. Future multi-tenant rollout is planned without overhauling the UX.
bullets: Destination and theme-based browsing with detailed itineraries, inclusions/exclusions, FAQs, and galleries.
Smart enquiry forms tied to CRM records with source/UTM tracking and WhatsApp-friendly sharing.
Admin CRM with lead pipeline, reusable package templates, pricing matrix, and quote exports.
Designed for daily simplicity while keeping the architecture ready for multi-tenant rollout.
SEO-friendly content structure plus basic reporting on leads, conversions, and top destinations.
